questions.text: Identify the image ?
questions.solution:
The above image shows subperiosteal abscess involving the medial periosteum and laminated papyracea, there is mucosal thickening involving the left ethmoid air cells. So this is Sinusitis with subperiosteal abscess.

Chandler's classification for infection of orbit.

KEY TAKEAWAY- orbital cellulitis will not localize to one side. It will be more diffuse.

Inflammation anterior to orbital septum is preseptal cellulitis.

Reference: Sutton's Textbook of Radiology and Imaging(8th edition)vol1 page no.698-699.

questions.text: A 2 year child presents with breathlessness. On chest x-ray, Identify the Object seen on the Chest Radiograph?
questions.solution:
Chest x ray showing radiopaque area with a double rim suggestive of button battery.

It is important to distinguish btw coin and button battery as button battery is highly alkaline so risk of perforation of esophagus are high therefore it is an emergency condition and urgent removal is required.

Coin in esophagus

KEY TAKEAWAY -

Reference: Guelfguat, M., Kaplinskiy, V., Reddy, S. H., & DiPoce, J. (2014). Clinical guidelines for imaging and reporting ingested foreign bodies. In American Journal of Roentgenology (Vol. 203, Issue 1, pp. 37–53). American Roentgen Ray Society. https://doi.org/10.2214/AJR.13.12185

questions.text: Identify the marked structure on the given Knee MRI?
questions.solution:
It is sagittal knee mri. All ligaments, tendons and meniscus are signal voids and they appear darker on T1 and T2.

Nomenclature of ACL and PCL are based on their attachment on tibia and not on femur therefore PCL attaches to posterior part of tibia and ACL attaches to anterior part of tibia.

Lateral meniscus forming bow tie appearance on sagittal mri of knee.

Reference: https/ radiopaedia.org

questions.text: Most sensitive for parathyroid tumor imaging:
questions.solution:
Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT) using Tc-99m Sestamibi is the most sensitive imaging modality for detecting parathyroid tumors, especially in cases of primary hyperparathyroidism caused by parathyroid adenomas.

  • Tc-99m Sestamibi (MIBI) scan works by preferentially accumulating in mitochondria-rich parathyroid adenomas.
  • SPECT (Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography) adds three-dimensional localization, significantly improving sensitivity and specificity.
  • Sensitivity of Tc-99m Sestamibi SPECT: 90%–95%, making it the most effective modality for localizing ectopic or small adenomas.

Incorrect Options:

(a) Tc-99m Sestamibi Scan (without SPECT)

  • While a Sestamibi scan is widely used, it is less sensitive than SPECT for small or ectopic adenomas.
  • Sensitivity: ~80% (lower than SPECT).

(c) Ultrasound (USG)

  • First-line imaging for parathyroid tumors due to availability, cost-effectiveness, and ease of use.
  • However, limited by operator dependency and difficulty detecting ectopic adenomas (e.g., retrosternal, intrathyroidal locations).
  • Sensitivity: ~70%-80% (lower than Tc-99m Sestamibi SPECT).

(d) MRI

  • Used in select cases, especially for recurrent or ectopic parathyroid adenomas.
  • Not as sensitive as Tc-99m Sestamibi SPECT for initial diagnosis.
  • High cost and less availability limit its use.

Reference: AIIMS-MAMC-PGI's Comprehensive textbook of diagnostic radiology pg 3844
